title: Yuri Vovk
text:
Yuri Vovk (; born 11 November 1988 in <a href="Lviv">Lviv</a>) is a <a href="Ukraine">Ukrainian</a> <a href="chess">chess</a> <a href="Grandmaster%20%28chess%29">grandmaster</a>. He was trained by <a href="Vladimir%20Grabinsky">Vladimir Grabinsky</a>, coach of the Ukrainian youth team.
Career.
In 2007 he was joint winner with <a href="Li%20Chao%20%28chess%20player%29">Li Chao</a> and <a href="Geetha%20Narayanan%20Gopal">G.N. Gopal</a> at the <a href="Chess%20tournament%23Tournament%20categories">category 12</a> Lake Sevan <a href="round-robin%20tournament">round-robin tournament</a> in <a href="Martuni%2C%20Armenia">Martuni, Armenia</a>.
He was awarded the grandmaster title in 2008.
In February 2009 he shared first place in the <a href="Cappelle-la-Grande%20Open">Cappelle-la-Grande Open</a> in France with <a href="Sanan%20Sjugirov">Sanan Sjugirov</a>, <a href="Parimarjan%20Negi">Parimarjan Negi</a>, <a href="Maxim%20Rodshtein">Maxim Rodshtein</a>, <a href="Sergey%20Fedorchuk">Sergey Fedorchuk</a>, <a href="Eric%20Hansen%20%28chess%20player%29">Eric Hansen</a>, <a href="Alexei%20Fedorov">Alexei Fedorov</a>, and <a href="Vlad-Cristian%20Jianu">Vlad-Cristian Jianu</a>, ahead of 106 Grandmasters and 76 <a href="International%20Master">International Master</a>s, scoring 7.5 points out of 9. In 2013 he finished equal first, placing eighth on tiebreak.
Other tournament results:
Vovk finished fifth at the 2015 <a href="European%20Individual%20Chess%20Championship">European Individual Chess Championship</a> in <a href="Jerusalem">Jerusalem</a>, scoring 7.5/11. This result enabled him to qualify for the <a href="Chess%20World%20Cup%202015">Chess World Cup 2015</a>, where he knocked out <a href="Ray%20Robson">Ray Robson</a> in the first round. In round two he was eliminated by <a href="Wei%20Yi">Wei Yi</a> in the <a href="Fast%20chess">blitz</a> tiebreak games.
He is the older brother of <a href="Andrey%20Vovk%20%28chess%20player%29">Andrey Vovk</a>.
